content: sugar puff xl scrunchie by danesha williams knitting pattern difficulty one-size-fits-all add a playful twist to your accessories collection with the sugar puff xl scrunchie this oversized piece is perfect for keeping your hair pulled back or just to jazz up your wrist it s the perfect project for using leftover yarn or experimenting with colors and textures treat yourself and your friends to the scrunchie of your dreams video tutorials and images are included for visual assistance www cocoaskein com thank you i am so grateful for your support of my cozy crafting journey this venture began as a way to help both myself and others find a moment of calm in the midst of life s pace your encouragement truly means the world to me as you settle in perhaps with a favorite movie i hope you find joy and serenity in knitting this scrunchie thank you once again from the bottom of my heart -danesha <3 2 sizing this scrunchie is one-size-fits-all it has a diameter and circumference of 13 cm 5 in yarn 140 128 yards meters 1 skein lion brand skein tones 100% acrylic 170 m 185 yds per 3 5 oz in shade truffle note you can use any worsted-weight yarn gauge is not super important for this project but it can be helpful to ensure the scrunchie size comes out as intended gauge post-blocking stockinette 18 sts x 21 rounds = 10 cm 4 using 5 mm us 8 needles needles 5 5 0mm us 8 dpns supplies ¼ elastic cut to 7 long tapestry needle sewing needle thread scissors 1 stitch marker tape measure 3 abbreviations bor beginning of the round co cast on dpns double-pointed needles k knit round s rounds st s stitch es inches 4 instructions cast on co 24 sts to 4 dpn 6 sts per dpn attach marker to first st to mark bor knit tube k in stockinette until your fabric measures around 40 long i knit for about 227 rounds to get to a length of 40 25 please note this can be adjusted with blocking so do not fret if your fabric is longer or shorter than 40 bind off using the traditional bind-off method block optional block using your preferred blocking method because i used acrylic yarn i blocked using the steam method but feel free to use any method that you like best when blocking slightly stretch your fabric to elongate the stitches initially the scrunchie was 40 25 long with a width of 2 5 after blocking the scrunchie was a length of 45 with a width of 2 25 forming scrunchie insert elastic into the scrunchie overlap the ends of the elastic by 0 5 to 1 and stitch together using a sewing needle and thread sew the cast-on and bind-off edges together this video has a great tutorial for doing this invisibly that s it your scrunchie is now complete 5 copyright & disclaimer © 2025 cocoa skein all
